summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from January 10, 2020, discussing the status of surveillance video from outside Jeffrey Epstein's jail cell during his July 2019 suicide attempt. The emails reveal that the video stored on a DVR was corrupted and unrecoverable despite FBI lab efforts, and that prosecutors had been aware of this issue since November 2019. The chain includes forwarded news reports about the video's deletion and its implications.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The accused child sex trafficker who was found in his jail cell in an apparent suicide attempt in July 2019; the subject of the missing surveillance video.

persons.name: Kenneth Karas
persons.context: The federal judge to whom prosecutors disclosed that prison authorities had inadvertently deleted surveillance video from outside Epstein's cell.

persons.name: Dave
persons.context: Addressed in the email chain to reach out to the New York office to validate or refine reports about the missing video.

events.title: Epstein's first suicide attempt in jail
events.description: Prison officers at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York found Jeffrey Epstein on the floor of his cell with a strip of bedsheet around his neck in an apparent suicide attempt.

events.title: Attorney request to preserve jail video
events.description: An attorney for Epstein's cellmate asked that MCC preserve video from outside the cell from the night of the suicide attempt.

events.title: AUSAs and investigative team made aware of video issue
events.description: The email states that the Assistant US Attorneys and the investigative team had been aware since November 2019 that the surveillance video from Epstein's cell during his suicide attempt was corrupted and unrecoverable.

events.title: Prosecutors disclose video deletion to judge
events.description: Prosecutors told US District Judge Kenneth Karas that prison authorities had inadvertently deleted surveillance video of the area outside Epstein's jail cell during his first suicide attempt due to a mix-up in the cell number.

events.title: FBI internal email chain about missing video
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss the corrupted and unrecoverable surveillance video from Epstein's cell, a request to validate reports about it, and note that AUSAs had been aware of the issue.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York
keyFacts: Surveillance video from outside Jeffrey Epstein's jail cell during his July 23, 2019, suicide attempt was stored on DVR 2 but was corrupted and could not be recovered by FBI computer technicians or the FBI Lab.
The video was inadvertently deleted due to a mix-up: MCC staff preserved footage from an incorrect cell because the computer system listed the wrong cell number for Epstein's cellmate.
Assistant US Attorneys and the investigative team had been aware of the video corruption and unrecoverability since November 2019, months before the January 2020 email chain.
The disclosure of the missing video was likely to revive conspiracy theories suggesting Epstein was murdered to prevent him from discussing his activities with influential friends.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination to validate and refine reports about the missing video before sending information to FBI Headquarters.
